Steel that belonged to Mr. Soze and was destined for Pakistan to be used in a Nuclear reactor. A very profitable violation of U.N. Regulations. You had no way of knowing this, because the man shipping the steel was working for Mr. Sate without his knowledge. + (Beat) Mr. Fenster and Mr. McManus hijacked a twin-prop cargo flight earlier this year out of Newark airport. The plane was carrying platinum and gold wiring. Also set for Pakistan. Kobayashi turns and points at Hockney.

dialogues.text: So why tell us?

dialogues.speaker: KOBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Because you have stolen from Mr. Soze. That you did not know you stole from him is the only reason you are still alive, but he feels you owe him. You will repay your debt.

dialogues.text: His name was Arturo Marquez. A petty smuggler out of Argentina. He was arrested in New York last year for trafficking. He escaped to California and http://www.godamongdirectors.com/scripts /usual.shtml

dialogues.text: Kobayashi. Bear nods.

dialogues.text: Arturo was strongly opposed 'to going back to prison. So much so that he informed on close to fifty guys. Guess who he names for a finale? Kujan finds one sheet and notices a paragraph is highligh

dialogues.text: Keaton has come to the four-foot-high door to the hold. T door is open slightly. Keaton finds this strange. He push the door open and steps inside. dialogues.speaker: KEATON
dialogues.text: Right behind you.

dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about. http://www.godamongdirectors.com/scripts /usual.shtml Pag  The Usual Suspects 6/4/09 1:33 PM

dialogues.text: Verbal looks into Kujan's eyes with genuine terror. Kujan face is red, his body trembles. His locomotive breathing the only sound in the room.

dialogues.text: I don't understand what you're saying. I saw Keaton get shot, I swear to you.

dialogues.text: Then why didn't you help him?

dialogues.text: I WAS AFRAID, OKAY? Somehow, I was sure it was Keyser Soze at that point. I couldn't bring myself to raise my gun to him.

dialogues.text: But Keaton...

The two men exchange words and the man in the suit pulls out a pistol. He poin it at Keaton.

Verbal can barely see the man from where he is now. The m in the suit is covered by shadows and the poor angle from barge. Verbal strains to see but he cannot. The man in the suit stops long enough to pull out a light He turns and walks back across the deck and out of sight. A moment later flames leap up from on the deck. The mesh of steel and rubber leaves a dark and open cocoo its base. MOVE INTO THE DARKNESS. Sirens are close now. Almost here. The sound of fire ragi out of control.

dialogues.text: Arturo Marquez. Ever hear of him?

dialogues.text: Wha- No.

dialogues.text: He was a stool pigeon for the Justice Department. He swore out a statement to Federal Marshals that he had seen and could positively identify one Keyser Soze and had intimate knowledge of his business, including, but not exclusive http://www.godamongdirectors.com/scripts /usual.shtml Pag  The Usual Suspects 6/4/09 1:33 PM to, drug trafficking and murder.

dialogues.speaker: VERBAL
dialogues.text: I never heard of him.

dialogues.speaker: KUJAN
dialogues.text: His own people were selling him to a gang of Hungarians. Most likely the same Hungarians that Sate all but wiped out back in Turkey. The money wasn't there for dope. The Hungarians were going to buy the one guy that could finger Soze for them.

dialogues.speaker: VERBAL
dialogues.text: I said I never heard of him.

dialogues.speaker: KUJAN
dialogues.text: But Keaton had. Edie Finneran was his extradition advisor. She knew who he was and what he knew.

dialogues.speaker: VERBAL
dialogues.text: I don't

dialogues.speaker: KUJAN
dialogues.text: There were no drugs on that boat. It was a hit. A suicide mission to whack out the one man that could finger Keyser Soze so Sate had a few thieves put to it. Men he knew he could march into certain death.

dialogues.speaker: VERBAL
dialogues.text: But how - wait. You're saying SOZE sent t us to kill someone?

dialogues.speaker: KUJAN
dialogues.text: I'm saying Keaton did. Verbal cannot grasp this. He squints, trying to understan

dialogues.text: Verbal, he left you behind for a reason. If you all knew Soze could find you anywhere, why was he ready to send you off with the money when he could have used you to take the boat? http://www.godamongdirectors.com/scripts /usual.shtml Pag  The Usual Suspects

dialogues.speaker: VERBAL
dialogues.text: He wanted me to live.

dialogues.speaker: KUJAN
dialogues.text: Why did he want you to live? A one-time dirty cop without a loyalty in the world finds it in his heart to save a worthless rat-cripple? No, sir. Why'

dialogues.speaker: VERBAL
dialogues.text: Edie.

dialogues.speaker: KUJAN
dialogues.text: I don't buy that reform story for a minute. And even if I did, I certainly don't believe he would send you to protect her. So why?

dialogues.speaker: VERBAL
dialogues.text: Because he was my friend.

dialogues.speaker: KUJAN
dialogues.text: No, Verbal. You weren't friends. Keaton didn't have friends. He saved you because he wanted it that way. It was his will. Verbal grinds to a mental halt, trying to grasp the implication .

dialogues.speaker: VERBAL
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: KUJAN
dialogues.text: Keaton was Keyser Soze

dialogues.speaker: VERBAL
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: KUJAN
dialogues.text: The kind of guy who could wrangle the wills of men like Hockney and McManus. The kind of man who could engineer a police line-up from all his years of contacts in N.Y.P.D. http://www.godamongdirectors.com/scripts /usual.shtml 112.

dialogues.speaker: SCRIPT DATE 5/25/94
dialogues.text: Page 116 of 126  The Usual Suspects Verbal stands on wobbly legs, shaking with anger.

dialogues.speaker: EDIE FINNERAN.
dialogues.text: A strange look crosses Verbal's face. Shock perhaps, revelation.

dialogues.speaker: KUJAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They found her yesterday in a hotel in Pennsylvania. Shot twice in the head. It starts to sink in with Verbal. His eyes swell.

dialogues.speaker: VERBAL
dialogues.text: Edie...

dialogues.speaker: KUJAN
dialogues.text: He used all of you to get him on that boat. He couldn't get on alone and he had to pull the trigger himself to make sure he got his man. The one man that could identify him.

dialogues.speaker: VERBAL
dialogues.text: This is all bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: KUJAN
dialogues.text: He left you to stay behind and tell us he was dead. You saw him die, right? Or did you? You had to hide when the first police cars showed up. You heard the shot, just before the fire but you didn't see him die.

dialogues.speaker: VERBAL
dialogues.text: I knew him. He would never -

dialogues.speaker: KUJAN
dialogues.text: He programmed you to tell us just what he wanted you to. Customs has been KUJAN (cont'd) investigating him for years. He knew we were close. You said it yourself. Where http://www.godamongdirectors.com/scripts /usual.shtml

dialogues.speaker: SCRIPT DATE 5/25/94
dialogues.text: Page 117 of 126  The Usual Suspects is the political pressure coming from? Why are you being protected? It's Keaton making sure you tell us what you're supposed to. Immunity is your reward.

dialogues.speaker: BUT WHY ME
dialogues.text: McMANUS? I'm a cripple. I'm stupid. Why me? Verbal hears the weight of his words and falls back in hi chair, Kujan looks at him with some pity,; but he is too in to stop.

dialogues.speaker: KUJAN
dialogues.text: Because you're a cripple, Verbal. Because you're stupid. Because you were weaker than them. Because you couldn't see far enough into him to know the truth. Verbal is crying now. He shakes his head, eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: KUJAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If he's dead, Verbal - if what you say is true, then it won't matter. It was his idea to hit the Taxi Service in New York, wasn't it? Tell me the truth.

dialogues.speaker: VERBAL
dialogues.text: (Sobbing) It was all Keaton. We followed him from the beginning. Kujan smiles with triumphant satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: VERBAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I didn't know. I saw him die. I believe he's dead. Christ

dialogues.speaker: KUJAN
